title: Arco Preciso vs Arco Zero
comparison_headline: When does a grinder stop being good enough?
comparison_intro: The Preciso is already a serious grinder that satisfies most home baristas. The Zero pushes into competition territory with larger burrs, true zero retention, and a particle distribution that brings out nuance most setups can't resolve. The honest question is whether your palate and machine can tell the difference.
hero_image_alt: Arco Preciso and Arco Zero grinders on a dark slate surface, the Zero noticeably taller and heavier, a refractometer and cupping spoon nearby suggesting advanced technique, shallow depth of field focusing on the burr adjustment collars, moody ambient lighting

boiler_type.product_a: N/A — Stepless flat burr grinder (54 mm burrs)
boiler_type.product_b: N/A — Stepless flat burr grinder (64 mm competition-grade burrs)

grind_compatibility.product_a: Stepless adjustment, low retention (~0.3g), single-dose capable
grind_compatibility.product_b: Stepless adjustment, true zero retention (<0.1g), purpose-built for single-dosing, tighter particle distribution

suitable_for.product_a: Home baristas who want stepless control and single-dosing capability at a sensible price
suitable_for.product_b: Advanced baristas who taste the difference between good and exceptional grind quality, and own a machine that can resolve it

not_suitable_for.product_a: Competition-focused baristas who need the tightest possible particle distribution and absolute zero retention
not_suitable_for.product_b: Anyone pairing it with an entry-level machine — the Zero's precision will be wasted on equipment that can't express it

upgrader.rationale: The Preciso already represents a massive upgrade from a stepped grinder — its quality ceiling is high enough that most upgraders won't reach it for a long time.

craft-barista.rationale: If you own a Studio or Studio Pro and regularly taste the difference between grind adjustments, the Zero's larger burrs and tighter distribution will give you clarity the Preciso can't match.

verdict: The Preciso is one of the best values in home espresso grinding and will satisfy most baristas for years. The Zero is for the subset of people who have trained their palate, invested in a capable machine, and want the grinder to stop being the limiting factor. If you are pairing with a Doppio, the Preciso is the right choice. If you own a Studio or Studio Pro and take extraction seriously, the Zero completes the setup.
